RESTATED[1] MEMORANDUM OF DECISION
PAUL MANNES, Bankruptcy Judge.
This matter comes before the court on a Motion to Amend and/or For Relief from this court's May 6, 2004 Order Dismissing Adversary Proceeding and a Motion to Allow Submission of Additional Evidence filed by the Plaintiff, Ford Motor Credit Company ("Ford"). The facts and procedural posture of this case are as follows.
Debtor filed a bankruptcy case under Chapter 7 on July 15, 2003. Her Statement of Intention filed pursuant to 11 U.S.C. § 521(2)(A) stated that she would surrender her 2000 Lincoln to Ford. Ford filed this adversary proceeding on December 23, 2003, seeking a declaratory judgment and damages for violation of the automatic stay against Donna Bonita Hemsley, d/b/a Tiger's Auto & Detail Shop. The Debtor, LaTasha LaVonne Bennett, purchased the Lincoln subject to a purchase money security interest that was acquired by Ford.
